snippet: Experts are tracking down and reinstalling furnishings that were taken from this Honolulu palace after Hawaii’s last queen was deposed in the 1890s.
abstract: Eve M Kahn Antiques column; Iolani Palace museum in Honolulu continues to reclaim belongings of Hawaii's last queen Liliuokalani that had been dispersed in 1890s after monarchy was overthrown; Morven Museum & Garden in Princeton, NJ, hosts exhibition Hail Specimen of Female Art! New Jersey Schoolgirl Needlework, 1726-1860.
lead_paragraph: Experts are tracking down and reinstalling furnishings that were taken from this Honolulu palace after Hawaii’s last queen was deposed in the 1890s.

headline.print_headline: A Hawaiian Palace Reclaims Its Heritage
headline.main: Iolani Palace in Hawaii Is Recovering Its Looted Furnishings
